I love that fans can now here some kpop songs through actual instruments and to put it to perspective for those who wonder how long it would have taken to learn this...  not sure what this universityâ€™s marching band practice performance/schedule is like, but most universities have a new set of halftime shows every week/game.. and some universities practice on field 3-4 days of that week for maybe 3-4 hours per day... though, the sets they did are pretty simple, and since theyâ€™re university students memorization for music shouldnâ€™t have been too bad, but maybe learning the choreo for idol could have been tough for the players and not the color guard lolol  if anyone is into Drum Corps International, professional marching band groups (made up of only color guard, brass and drum line) and competition , the Blue Devilâ€™s did a minor set of GOT7s I Like You a few years back.. a lot of ppl didnâ€™t like the set simply bc it wasnâ€™t a western song and that â€œit didnâ€™t match their themeâ€ but fast forward a few years, iâ€™m glad people and other kpop fans like army are appreciating the addition of a kpop song and the hard work ppl put themselves through for marching band :,)

To see them become from some of the lowest-paid rookie groups in Korea to a global phenomenon, makes me just feel so proud of my boys and how well theyâ€™ve done. I remember being in a small shop in Korea and hearing one of their early songs and just bopping along to it, being only 12.
